intro: Collomia gracilis, commonly known as slender phlox, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Canada. It belongs to the family Polemoniaceae and is characterized by its delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has slender stems and small, lance-shaped leaves, and is often found in alpine or subalpine regions. Collomia gracilis is an herbaceous perennial that is relatively low maintenance and attracts pollinators like bees and butterflies.
